missionProperties.repositionOverride: Block access to doors and terminals.

events.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You arrive at Sorin’s Hoth outpost. It is small, but well defended, patrolled by snowtroopers and with spotlight towers set up around it. After some stealthy infiltration and searching, you find a ventilation port through which you are able to enter the facility.

{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.

eventActions.tbText: Crawling through the ventilation, you are able to get a sense of the small base: several small rooms with various consoles and patrol droids roaming the corridors, along with other security measures.

translatedEntityProperties.theText: When a Patrol Droid is triggered, click "Trigger Patrol Droid".
When a Patrol Droid is triggered, click "Trigger Patrol Droid".

eventActions.tbText:
{-} Imperial mission tokens represent patrol droids.
{-} Various Rebel actions can trigger the patrol droids. When a Rebel figure triggers the patrol droids, click the red or yellow highlight and select "Trigger Patrol Droids". If patrol droids are close to the Rebel figure that triggered them, {D} increases.
{-} When a Rebel figure declares an attack, he may apply -1 {H} to the attack results. If he does not, he triggers the patrol droids after the attack resolves.
{-} When a Rebel figure performs a move, he may reduce the number of movement points gained by 2. If he does not, he triggers the patrol droids. 
{-} When a Rebel figure interacts, he must test {J}. If he fails, he triggers the patrol droids after the interact resolves.
Imperial forces patrol the corridors, too.
There have to be various computer consoles with interesting intel in the facility.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
The computer console hums softly, data spooling across its display. Maybe some Intel can be gained here.

{-} A healthy Rebel figure can interact with a terminal to gain intel. When a Rebel figure interacts, he must test {J}. If he fails, he triggers the patrol droids after the interact resolves.

eventActions.tbText:
{-} A healthy Rebel figure can interact with a terminal to gain intel.
{-} The Rebels win when all intel has been gathered. 
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

eventActions.theText:
{-} Imperial mission tokens represent patrol droids.
{-} Various Rebel actions can trigger the patrol droids. When a Rebel figure triggers the patrol droids, click the red or yellow highlight and select "Trigger Patrol Droids". If patrol droids are close to the Rebel figure that triggered them, {D} increases.
{-} When a Rebel figure declares an attack, he may apply -1 {H} to the attack results. If he does not, he triggers the patrol droids after the attack resolves.
{-} When a Rebel figure performs a move, he may reduce the number of movement points gained by 2. If he does not, he triggers the patrol droids. 
{-} When a Rebel figure interacts, he must test {J}. If he fails, he triggers the patrol droids after the interact resolves.
{-} A healthy Rebel figure can interact with a terminal to gain intel.
{-} The Rebels win when all intel has been gathered. 
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

events.eventText:
You're reasonably certain that you have all the data the facility has to offer, and alert klaxons are blaring. You escape out of the facility, and, after sprinting away from blaster fire for a half mile, you find your pilot waiting for extraction.

In addition to the files you've already decrypted, you also managed to find a substantial amount of Imperial code. Hopefully, after it’s analyzed, it will reveal the Empire’s final plan.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} Each hero receives 2 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

eventActions.tbText:
When you finally return from your mission you send off the coded Imperial information you retrieved for analysis. With luck, the Alliance will be able to discover the Empire’s next move in time to respond.

{-} Place Story Mission card “The Last Line” into play facedown. The text on a facedown Story Mission card is hidden information to Rebel players. When the Rebel players need to resolve a story mission, and the active Story Mission card is facedown, that card is turned faceup and is no longer hidden information.

eventActions.mainText: Are at least half of the heroes wounded?

events.eventText:
Although the information is not complete, you have no choice but to flee and hope you didn’t miss anything vital.

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

eventActions.tbText:
When you finally return from your mission you send off the coded Imperial information you retrieved for analysis. With luck, the Alliance will be able to discover the Empire’s next move in time to respond.

{-} Place Story Mission card “Disaster” into play facedown. The text on a facedown Story Mission card is hidden information to Rebel players. When the Rebel players need to resolve a story mission, and the active Story Mission card is facedown, that card is turned faceup and is no longer hidden information.

events.eventText:
"Octavion Sorin, General. Newly promoted. Although his record is not spotless, Command feels that his drive and devotion to the Empire warrant reward. His first assignment is to locate Rebel survivors of the Battle of Hoth and extract information from them pertaining to Rebel High Command."

{-} Test {J}. If you fail, trigger the patrol droids after the interact resolves.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
The computer console hums softly, data spooling across its display. Maybe some Intel can be gained here.

{-} A healthy Rebel figure can interact with a terminal to gain intel. When a Rebel figure interacts, he must test {J}. If he fails, he triggers the patrol droids after the interact resolves.

events.eventText:
"Dengar’s work at Echo Base was exemplary. Though he failed to secure Solo, his sabotage and subsequent assault on the Rebels had a major impact in battle. He continues to be a powerful asset, for a price...”

{-} Test {J}. If you fail, trigger the patrol droids after the interact resolves.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
The computer console hums softly, data spooling across its display. Maybe some Intel can be gained here.

{-} A healthy Rebel figure can interact with a terminal to gain intel. When a Rebel figure interacts, he must test {J}. If he fails, he triggers the patrol droids after the interact resolves.

events.eventText:
"Project Imperial Glory is well on track. The final push should lead us to all the information we require."

{-} Test {J}. If you fail, trigger the patrol droids after the interact resolves.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
The computer console hums softly, data spooling across its display. Maybe some Intel can be gained here.

{-} A healthy Rebel figure can interact with a terminal to gain intel. When a Rebel figure interacts, he must test {J}. If he fails, he triggers the patrol droids after the interact resolves.

events.eventText:
"Haven: a small, village-sized outpost in the Ison system, run by a man named Benex. Sympathetic to the Rebellion. Housing fugitives. Priority level 2."

{-} Test {J}. If you fail, trigger the patrol droids after the interact resolves.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
The computer console hums softly, data spooling across its display. Maybe some Intel can be gained here.

{-} A healthy Rebel figure can interact with a terminal to gain intel. When a Rebel figure interacts, he must test {J}. If he fails, he triggers the patrol droids after the interact resolves.

events.eventText: The connecting door slides open.

translatedEntityProperties.theText: A simple door connects the northern and southern part of Sorin's base.

eventActions.tbText: {-} Test {J}. If you fail, trigger the patrol droids after the interact resolves.

events.eventText: The door slides open to reveal a small room with a couple of computer consoles.

eventActions.tbText: {-} Test {J}. If you fail, trigger the patrol droids after the interact resolves.

events.eventText: The door slides open to reveal a workshop littered with tools and parts.

eventActions.tbText: {-} Test {J}. If you fail, trigger the patrol droids after the interact resolves.

events.eventText: The door slides open to reveal a room full of work stations and control panels.

eventActions.tbText: {-} Test {J}. If you fail, trigger the patrol droids after the interact resolves.

events.eventText:
A man in an Imperial uniform looks up with an expression of annoyance on his face. "Who are you?", he snaps. "What are you doing here?" Before you can answer, he is already drawing his blaster, shouting for the guards.

{-} Deploy the <color="red">Imperial Officer</color> behind the door, exactly 4 spaces away from the door.
Suddenly, alarms start blaring through the facility. Opening the door must have triggered them.

You notice too late that the door was rigged. You throw yourself out harm's way as a hidden mine detonates, sending shrapnel everywhere, but it's too late to escape the entire blast.

{-} Roll 1 red die. The figure that opened the door suffers {H} equal to the {H} results and becomes <color="red">Bleeding</color>.

eventActions.mainText: How many Patrol Droids are within 3 spaces of the Rebel figure that triggered them?

inputList.theText:
The patrol droids move in to investigate.

{-} All Patrol Droids not within 3 spaces of the Rebel figure that triggered them move 4 toward the Rebel that triggered them.

events.eventText:
The patrol droid sounds the alarm.

{-} All Patrol Droids not within 3 spaces of the Rebel figure that triggered them move 4 toward the Rebel that triggered them.

The patrol droids sound the alarm.

{-} All Patrol Droids not within 3 spaces of the Rebel figure that triggered them move 4 toward the Rebel that triggered them.

The patrol droids sound the alarm.

{-} All Patrol Droids not within 3 spaces of the Rebel figure that triggered them move 4 toward the Rebel that triggered them.

The patrol droids continue their patrols.

{-} Each Patrol Droid moves 4 toward their respective highlight:
— Patrol Droids on fully snow-covered spaces move toward the yellow highlight, moving clock-wise over snow-covered spaces.
— Patrol Droids not on fully snow-covered spaces move toward the red highlight, moving clock-wise over spaces not fully snow-covered spaces.

eventActions.tbText: A door in the ceiling slides open, and another patrol droid comes floating out of the hatch.

events.eventText: Because the Rebels claimed 3 terminals, the heroes receive 100 credits per hero.
The threat level of the next mission (and only the next mission) increases by 1. During the Rebel Upgrade stage, the Rebel players can decide to spend 50 credits per hero to prevent this.
